oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Communicating Ethical Arguments to Organic Consumers: A Study Across Five European Countries
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Naspetti, Simona
Zanoli, Raffaele
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Values, standards and certification
Consumer issues
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Additional ethical claims were tested with mock organic egg labels in five EU countries. The attitudes towards the advertising labels were assessed by multiple copy testing measures. A total of 156 individual responses were analysed. The study confirms the difficulty of conducting advertising research in a multicultural framework, and shows that additional local/ regional claims can reinforce the appeal of organic products .
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Naspetti, Simona and Zanoli, Raffaele (2011) Communicating Ethical Arguments to Organic Consumers: A Study Across Five European Countries. journal of Food System Dynamics, 2 (3), pp. 253-273.
